name: py-cython
description: The Cython compiler for writing C extensions for the Python language.

dependencies.name: py-pip
dependencies.description: The PyPA recommended tool for installing Python packages.

dependencies.name: py-setuptools
dependencies.description:
A Python utility that aids in the process of downloading, building,
upgrading, installing, and uninstalling Python packages.

dependencies.name: gdb
dependencies.description:
GDB, the GNU Project debugger, allows you to see what is going on
'inside' another program while it executes -- or what another program
was doing at the moment it crashed.

dependent_to.name: py-pysam
dependent_to.description: A python module for reading, manipulating and writing genomic data sets.

dependent_to.name: py-fastavro
dependent_to.description: Fastavro for Python.

dependent_to.name: py-yt
dependent_to.description:
Volumetric Data Analysis yt is a python package for analyzing and
visualizing volumetric, multi-resolution data from astrophysical
simulations, radio telescopes, and a burgeoning interdisciplinary
community.

dependent_to.name: py-pygpu
dependent_to.description: Python packge for the libgpuarray C library.

dependent_to.name: py-triangle
dependent_to.description: Python bindings to the triangle library

dependent_to.name: py-scipy
dependent_to.description:
SciPy (pronounced "Sigh Pie") is a Scientific Library for Python. It
provides many user-friendly and efficient numerical routines such as
routines for numerical integration and optimization.

dependent_to.name: py-pyprecice
dependent_to.description:
This package provides python language bindings for the C++ library
preCICE.

dependent_to.name: py-dp-gp-cluster
dependent_to.description:
DP_GP_cluster clusters genes by expression over a time course using a
Dirichlet process Gaussian process model.

dependent_to.name: py-netcdf4
dependent_to.description: Python interface to the netCDF Library.

dependent_to.name: py-pyheadtail
dependent_to.description:
CERN PyHEADTAIL numerical n-body simulation code for simulating macro-
particle beam dynamics with collective effects.

dependent_to.name: py-lap
dependent_to.description:
lap is a linear assignment problem solver using Jonker-Volgenant
algorithm for dense (LAPJV) or sparse (LAPMOD) matrices.

dependent_to.name: py-pyproj
dependent_to.description:
Python interface to PROJ (cartographic projections and coordinate
transformations library).

dependent_to.name: py-dgl
dependent_to.description:
Deep Graph Library (DGL). DGL is an easy-to-use, high performance and
scalable Python package for deep learning on graphs. DGL is framework
agnostic, meaning if a deep graph model is a component of an end-to-end
application, the rest of the logics can be implemented in any major
frameworks, such as PyTorch, Apache MXNet or TensorFlow.

dependent_to.name: py-openmc
dependent_to.description:
OpenMC is a community-developed Monte Carlo neutron and photon transport
simulation code. It is capable of performing fixed source, k-eigenvalue,
and subcritical multiplication calculations on models built using either
a constructive solid geometry or CAD representation. OpenMC supports
both continuous-energy and multigroup transport. The continuous-energy
particle interaction data is based on a native HDF5 format that can be
generated from ACE files produced by NJOY. Parallelism is enabled via a
hybrid MPI and OpenMP programming model.

dependent_to.name: libseccomp
dependent_to.description: The main libseccomp repository

dependent_to.name: lhapdf
dependent_to.description:
LHAPDF is a general purpose C++ interpolator, used for evaluating PDFs
from discretised data files.

dependent_to.name: py-statsmodels
dependent_to.description: Statistical computations and models for use with SciPy

dependent_to.name: py-numcodecs
dependent_to.description:
Numcodecs is a Python package providing buffer compression and
transformation codecs for use in data storage and communication
applications.

dependent_to.name: py-petsc4py
dependent_to.description: This package provides Python bindings for the PETSc package.

dependent_to.name: py-whatshap
dependent_to.description:
WhatsHap is a software for phasing genomic variants using DNA sequencing
reads, also called read-based phasing or haplotype assembly.

dependent_to.name: py-ucx-py
dependent_to.description:
UCX-Py is the Python interface for UCX, a low-level high-performance
networking library. UCX and UCX-Py supports several transport methods
including InfiniBand and NVLink while still using traditional networking
protocols like TCP.

dependent_to.name: py-cuml
dependent_to.description:
cuML is a suite of libraries that implement machine learning algorithms
and mathematical primitives functions that share compatible APIs with
other RAPIDS projects.

dependent_to.name: py-scikit-image
dependent_to.description:
Image processing algorithms for SciPy, including IO, morphology,
filtering, warping, color manipulation, object detection, etc.

dependent_to.name: py-pygeos
dependent_to.description:
PyGEOS is a C/Python library with vectorized geometry functions. The
geometry operations are done in the open-source geometry library GEOS.
PyGEOS wraps these operations in NumPy ufuncs providing a performance
improvement when operating on arrays of geometries.

dependent_to.name: py-srsly
dependent_to.description: srsly: Modern high-performance serialization utilities for Python.

dependent_to.name: py-vcf-kit
dependent_to.description:
VCF-kit is a command-line based collection of utilities for performing
analysis on Variant Call Format (VCF) files.

dependent_to.name: gptune
dependent_to.description:
GPTune is an autotuning framework that relies on multitask and transfer
learnings to help solve the underlying black-box optimization problem
using Bayesian optimization methodologies.

dependent_to.name: py-cython-bbox
dependent_to.description:
cython_bbox is widely used in object detection tasks. To my best
knowledge, it was first implemented in Faster-RCNN. Since then, almost
all object detection projects use the source code directly. In order to
use it in standalone code snippets or small projects, I make it a pypi
module. The cython_bbox.pyx is totally borrowed from Faster-RCNN. Thanks
RBG!

dependent_to.name: steps
dependent_to.description: STochastic Engine for Pathway Simulation

dependent_to.name: py-memprof
dependent_to.description:
memprof logs and plots the memory usage of all the variables during the
execution of the decorated methods.

dependent_to.name: py-pywavelets
dependent_to.description:
PyWavelets is a free Open Source library for wavelet transforms in
Python

dependent_to.name: py-espresso
dependent_to.description:
ESPResSo is a highly versatile software package for performing and
analyzing scientific Molecular Dynamics many-particle simulations of
coarse-grained atomistic or bead-spring models as they are used in soft
matter research in physics, chemistry and molecular biology. It can be
used to simulate systems such as polymers, liquid crystals, colloids,
polyelectrolytes, ferrofluids and biological systems, for example DNA
and lipid membranes. It also has a DPD and lattice Boltzmann solver for
hydrodynamic interactions, and allows several particle couplings to the
LB fluid.

dependent_to.name: py-cyvcf2
dependent_to.description: fast vcf parsing with cython + htslib

dependent_to.name: py-reproject
dependent_to.description:
The reproject package is a Python package to reproject astronomical
images using various techniques via a uniform interface. By
reprojection, we mean the re-gridding of images from one world
coordinate system to another (for example changing the pixel resolution,
orientation, coordinate system). Currently, we have implemented
reprojection of celestial images by interpolation (like SWARP), as well
as by finding the exact overlap between pixels on the celestial sphere
(like Montage). It can also reproject to/from HEALPIX projections by
relying on the astropy-healpix package.

dependent_to.name: py-rmm
dependent_to.description:
RMM: RAPIDS Memory Manager. Achieving optimal performance in GPU-centric
workflows frequently requires customizing how host and device memory are
allocated.

dependent_to.name: py-hdbscan
dependent_to.description:
HDBSCAN - Hierarchical Density-Based Spatial Clustering of Applications
with Noise. Performs DBSCAN over varying epsilon values and integrates
the result to find a clustering that gives the best stability over
epsilon. This allows HDBSCAN to find clusters of varying densities
(unlike DBSCAN), and be more robust to parameter selection. In practice
this means that HDBSCAN returns a good clustering straight away with
little or no parameter tuning -- and the primary parameter, minimum
cluster size, is intuitive and easy to select. HDBSCAN is ideal for
exploratory data analysis; it's a fast and robust algorithm that you can
trust to return meaningful clusters (if there are any).

dependent_to.name: py-qiskit-terra
dependent_to.description:
Qiskit is an open-source SDK for working with quantum computers at the
level of extended quantum circuits, operators, and algorithms.

dependent_to.name: py-cogent
dependent_to.description: A toolkit for statistical analysis of biological sequences.

dependent_to.name: py-pyfftw
dependent_to.description:
A pythonic wrapper around FFTW, the FFT library, presenting a unified
interface for all the supported transforms.

dependent_to.name: py-gevent
dependent_to.description: gevent is a coroutine-based Python networking library.

dependent_to.name: py-gsd
dependent_to.description:
The GSD file format is the native file format for HOOMD-blue. GSD files
store trajectories of the HOOMD-blue system state in a binary file with
efficient random access to frames. GSD allows all particle and topology
properties to vary from one frame to the next. Use the GSD Python API to
specify the initial condition for a HOOMD-blue simulation or analyze
trajectory output with a script. Read a GSD trajectory with a
visualization tool to explore the behavior of the simulation.

dependent_to.name: py-grpcio
dependent_to.description: HTTP/2-based RPC framework.

dependent_to.name: py-nibetaseries
dependent_to.description: BetaSeries Correlations implemented in Nipype.

dependent_to.name: platypus
dependent_to.description: A Haplotype-Based Variant Caller For Next Generation Sequence Data

dependent_to.name: n2p2
dependent_to.description:
N2p2 (The neural network potential package) provides ready-to-use
software for high-dimensional neural network potentials in computational
physics and chemistry.

dependent_to.name: py-falcon
dependent_to.description:
Falcon is a reliable, high-performance Python web framework for building
large-scale app backends and microservices.

dependent_to.name: py-gpy
dependent_to.description: The Gaussian Process Toolbox.

dependent_to.name: py-numpy
dependent_to.description:
NumPy is the fundamental package for scientific computing with Python.
It contains among other things: a powerful N-dimensional array object,
sophisticated (broadcasting) functions, tools for integrating C/C++ and
Fortran code, and useful linear algebra, Fourier transform, and random
number capabilities

dependent_to.name: py-pomegranate
dependent_to.description: Fast, flexible and easy to use probabilistic modelling in Python.

dependent_to.name: py-pyworld
dependent_to.description:
PyWorld wrappers WORLD, which is a free software for high-quality speech
analysis, manipulation and synthesis. It can estimate fundamental
frequency (F0), aperiodicity and spectral envelope and also generate the
speech like input speech with only estimated parameters.i

dependent_to.name: py-abipy
dependent_to.description: Python package to automate ABINIT calculations and analyze the results.

dependent_to.name: py-grpcio-tools
dependent_to.description: Protobuf code generator for gRPC

dependent_to.name: py-apache-beam
dependent_to.description: Apache Beam is a unified programming model for Batch and Streaming.

dependent_to.name: py-rasterio
dependent_to.description:
Rasterio reads and writes geospatial raster data. Geographic information
systems use GeoTIFF and other formats to organize and store gridded, or
raster, datasets. Rasterio reads and writes these formats and provides a
Python API based on N-D arrays.

dependent_to.name: py-h5py
dependent_to.description:
The h5py package provides both a high- and low-level interface to the
HDF5 library from Python.

dependent_to.name: py-ray
dependent_to.description:
A system for parallel and distributed Python that unifies the ML
ecosystem.

dependent_to.name: py-symengine
dependent_to.description: Python wrappers for SymEngine, a symbolic manipulation library.

dependent_to.name: py-bx-python
dependent_to.description:
The bx-python project is a python library and associated set of scripts
to allow for rapid implementation of genome scale analyses.

dependent_to.name: py-angel
dependent_to.description: ANGEL: Robust Open Reading Frame prediction

dependent_to.name: py-liac-arff
dependent_to.description:
The liac-arff module implements functions to read and write ARFF files
in Python.

dependent_to.name: py-charm4py
dependent_to.description:
Charm4py (Charm++ for Python) is a distributed computing and parallel
programming framework for Python, for the productive development of
fast, parallel and scalable applications. It is built on top of Charm++,
a C++ adaptive runtime system that has seen extensive use in the
scientific and high-performance computing (HPC) communities across many
disciplines, and has been used to develop applications that run on a
wide range of devices: from small multi-core devices up to the largest
supercomputers.

dependent_to.name: py-atropos
dependent_to.description:
Atropos is tool for specific, sensitive, and speedy trimming of NGS
reads. It is a fork of the venerable Cutadapt read trimmer.

dependent_to.name: py-pyzmq
dependent_to.description: PyZMQ: Python bindings for zeromq.

dependent_to.name: neuron
dependent_to.description:
NEURON is a simulation environment for single and networks of neurons.
NEURON is a simulation environment for modeling individual and networks
of neurons. NEURON models individual neurons via the use of sections
that are automatically subdivided into individual compartments, instead
of requiring the user to manually create compartments.

dependent_to.name: hicops
dependent_to.description:
HiCOPS is a software framework for accelerating database peptide search
workflows on supercomputers. HiCOPS provided algorithm-independent
parallelizations and optimizations can be extended into new HPC database
search algorithms or scalably accelerate the existing ones.

dependent_to.name: py-tables
dependent_to.description:
PyTables is a package for managing hierarchical datasets and designed to
efficiently and easily cope with extremely large amounts of data.

dependent_to.name: py-pycompadre
dependent_to.description:
The Compadre Toolkit provides a performance portable solution for the
parallel evaluation of computationally dense kernels. The toolkit
specifically targets the Generalized Moving Least Squares (GMLS)
approach, which requires the inversion of small dense matrices. The
result is a set of weights that provide the information needed for remap
or entries that constitute the rows of some globally sparse matrix.

dependent_to.name: professor
dependent_to.description: Professor Monte-Carlo tuning package

dependent_to.name: py-cudf
dependent_to.description:
Built based on the Apache Arrow columnar memory format, cuDF is a GPU
DataFrame library for loading, joining, aggregating, filtering, and
otherwise manipulating data.

dependent_to.name: openmm
dependent_to.description:
A high performance toolkit for molecular simulation. Use it as a
library, or as an application. We include extensive language bindings
for Python, C, C++, and even Fortran. The code is open source and
actively maintained on Github, licensed under MIT and LGPL. Part of the
Omnia suite of tools for predictive biomolecular simulation.

dependent_to.name: py-pandas
dependent_to.description:
pandas is a fast, powerful, flexible and easy to use open source data
analysis and manipulation tool, built on top of the Python programming
language.

dependent_to.name: py-lws
dependent_to.description: Fast spectrogram phase recovery using Local Weighted Sums

dependent_to.name: py-pymumps
dependent_to.description: Python bindings for MUMPS, a parallel sparse direct solver

dependent_to.name: py-cartopy
dependent_to.description: Cartopy - a cartographic python library with matplotlib support.

dependent_to.name: ibmisc
dependent_to.description: Misc. reusable utilities used by IceBin.

dependent_to.name: py-pyomo
dependent_to.description:
Pyomo is a Python-based open-source software package that supports a
diverse set of optimization capabilities for formulating and analyzing
optimization models.

dependent_to.name: py-fastrlock
dependent_to.description:
This is a C-level implementation of a fast, re-entrant, optimistic lock
for CPython.

dependent_to.name: py-fastdtw
dependent_to.description:
Python implementation of FastDTW
(http://cs.fit.edu/~pkc/papers/tdm04.pdf), which is an approximate
Dynamic Time Warping (DTW) algorithm that provides optimal or near-
optimal alignments with an O(N) time and memory complexity.

dependent_to.name: py-astropy
dependent_to.description:
The Astropy Project is a community effort to develop a single core
package for Astronomy in Python and foster interoperability between
Python astronomy packages.

dependent_to.name: py-macs2
dependent_to.description: MACS2 Model-based Analysis of ChIP-Seq

dependent_to.name: py-pycbc
dependent_to.description:
PyCBC is a software package used to explore astrophysical sources of
gravitational waves. It contains algorithms to analyze gravitational-
wave data from the LIGO and Virgo detectors, detect coalescing compact
binaries, and measure the astrophysical parameters of detected sources.
PyCBC was used in the first direct detection of gravitational waves and
is used in the flagship analysis of LIGO and Virgo data.

dependent_to.name: py-bcolz
dependent_to.description:
bcolz provides columnar and compressed data containers. Column storage
allows for efficiently querying tables with a large number of columns.
It also allows for cheap addition and removal of column. In addition,
bcolz objects are compressed by default for reducing memory/disk I/O
needs. The compression process is carried out internally by Blosc, a
high-performance compressor that is optimized for binary data.

dependent_to.name: py-configspace
dependent_to.description:
Creation and manipulation of parameter configuration spaces for
automated algorithm configuration and hyperparameter tuning.

dependent_to.name: py-shapely
dependent_to.description: Manipulation and analysis of geometric objects in the Cartesian plane.

dependent_to.name: py-gemini
dependent_to.description:
GEMINI (GEnome MINIng) is a flexible framework for exploring genetic
variation in the context of the wealth of genome annotations available
for the human genome.

dependent_to.name: py-pot
dependent_to.description:
This open source Python library provide several solvers for
optimization problems related to Optimal Transport for signal, image
processing and machine learning.

dependent_to.name: py-pyarrow
dependent_to.description:
A cross-language development platform for in-memory data. This package
contains the Python bindings.

dependent_to.name: yoda
dependent_to.description: YODA - Yet more Objects for Data Analysis

dependent_to.name: minimap2
dependent_to.description:
Minimap2 is a versatile sequence alignment program that aligns DNA or
mRNA sequences against a large reference database. Mappy provides a
convenient interface to minimap2.

dependent_to.name: py-pycocotools
dependent_to.description: Official APIs for the MS-COCO dataset.

dependent_to.name: py-dipy
dependent_to.description:
Diffusion MRI utilities in python. DIPY is the paragon 3D/4D+ imaging
library in Python. Contains generic methods for spatial normalization,
signal processing, machine learning, statistical analysis and
visualization of medical images. Additionally, it contains specialized
methods for computational anatomy including diffusion, perfusion and
structural imaging.

dependent_to.name: zfp
dependent_to.description:
zfp is a compressed number format for multidimensional floating-point
and integer arrays. zfp provides compressed-array classes that support
high throughput read and write random access to individual array
elements. zfp also supports serial and parallel (OpenMP and CUDA)
compression of whole arrays.

dependent_to.name: mxnet
dependent_to.description:
MXNet is a deep learning framework designed for both efficiency and
flexibility.

dependent_to.name: py-scikit-learn-extra
dependent_to.description:
A set of useful tools compatible with scikit-learn scikit-learn-extra is
a Python module for machine learning that extends scikit-learn. It
includes algorithms that are useful but do not satisfy the scikit-learn
inclusion criteria, for instance due to their novelty or lower citation
number.

dependent_to.name: py-pythonsollya
dependent_to.description: Python wrapper for the Sollya library

dependent_to.name: plumed
dependent_to.description:
PLUMED is an open source library for free energy calculations in
molecular systems which works together with some of the most popular
molecular dynamics engines. Free energy calculations can be performed as
a function of many order parameters with a particular focus on
biological problems, using state of the art methods such as
metadynamics, umbrella sampling and Jarzynski-equation based steered MD.
The software, written in C++, can be easily interfaced with both fortran
and C/C++ codes.

dependent_to.name: py-anuga
dependent_to.description:
ANUGA (pronounced "AHnooGAH") is open-source software for the simulation
of the shallow water equation, in particular it can be used to model
tsunamis and floods.

dependent_to.name: py-mikado
dependent_to.description:
Mikado is a lightweight Python3 pipeline whose purpose is to facilitate
the identification of expressed loci from RNA-Seq data * and to select
the best models in each locus.

dependent_to.name: py-scikit-learn
dependent_to.description: A set of python modules for machine learning and data mining.

dependent_to.name: py-yarl
dependent_to.description: The module provides handy URL class for URL parsing and changing.

dependent_to.name: py-stratify
dependent_to.description:
Vectorized interpolators that are especially useful for Nd vertical
interpolation/stratification of atmospheric and oceanographic datasets.

dependent_to.name: py-adios
dependent_to.description: NumPy bindings of ADIOS1

dependent_to.name: py-htseq
dependent_to.description:
HTSeq is a Python package that provides infrastructure to process data
from high-throughput sequencing assays.

dependent_to.name: py-networkit
dependent_to.description:
NetworKit is a growing open-source toolkit for large-scale network
analysis. Its aim is to provide tools for the analysis of large networks
in the size range from thousands to billions of edges. For this purpose,
it implements efficient graph algorithms, many of them parallel to
utilize multicore architectures. These are meant to compute standard
measures of network analysis, such as degree sequences, clustering
coefficients, and centrality measures. In this respect, NetworKit is
comparable to packages such as NetworkX, albeit with a focus on
parallelism and scalability.

dependent_to.name: py-cftime
dependent_to.description:
Python library for decoding time units and variable values in a netCDF
file conforming to the Climate and Forecasting (CF) netCDF conventions

dependent_to.name: py-pycortex
dependent_to.description: Python Cortical mapping software for fMRI data.

dependent_to.name: py-pyscipopt
dependent_to.description: Python interface for the SCIP Optimization Suite

dependent_to.name: py-fiona
dependent_to.description: Fiona reads and writes spatial data files.

dependent_to.name: rivet
dependent_to.description: Rivet - the particle-physics MC analysis toolkit

dependent_to.name: py-mpi4py
dependent_to.description:
This package provides Python bindings for the Message Passing Interface
(MPI) standard. It is implemented on top of the MPI-1/MPI-2
specification and exposes an API which grounds on the standard MPI-2 C++
bindings.

dependent_to.name: py-rseqc
dependent_to.description:
RSeQC package provides a number of useful modules that can
comprehensively evaluate high throughput sequence data especially RNA-
seq data.

dependent_to.name: py-cf-units
dependent_to.description:
Units of measure as required by the Climate and Forecast (CF) metadata
conventions.

dependent_to.name: memsurfer
dependent_to.description:
MemSurfer is a tool to compute and analyze membrane surfaces found in a
wide variety of large-scale molecular simulations.

dependent_to.name: py-amqp
dependent_to.description: Low-level AMQP client for Python (fork of amqplib).

dependent_to.name: nest
dependent_to.description:
NEST is a simulator for spiking neural network models It focuses on the
dynamics, size and structure of neural systems rather than on the exact
morphology of individual neurons.

dependent_to.name: py-breakseq2
dependent_to.description: nucleotide-resolution analysis of structural variants

dependent_to.name: py-mmcv
dependent_to.description:
MMCV is a foundational python library for computer vision research and
supports many research projects in MMLAB, such as MMDetection and
MMAction.

dependent_to.name: py-brian2
dependent_to.description: A clock-driven simulator for spiking neural networks

dependent_to.name: py-pyjnius
dependent_to.description: Pyjnius is a Python library for accessing Java classes.

dependent_to.name: py-biom-format
dependent_to.description:
The BIOM file format (canonically pronounced biome) is designed to be a
general-use format for representing biological sample by observation
contingency tables.

dependent_to.name: py-python-crfsuite
dependent_to.description: python-crfsuite is a python binding to CRFsuite.

dependent_to.name: py-datrie
dependent_to.description:
Super-fast, efficiently stored Trie for Python (2.x and 3.x). Uses
libdatrie.

dependent_to.name: py-crossmap
dependent_to.description:
CrossMap is a program for convenient conversion of genome coordinates
(or annotation files) between different assemblies

dependent_to.name: py-slepc4py
dependent_to.description: This package provides Python bindings for the SLEPc package.

dependent_to.name: py-mo-pack
dependent_to.description:
Packing methods used to encode and decode the data payloads of Met
Office Unified Model 'fields'

dependent_to.name: py-yahmm
dependent_to.description: YAHMM is a HMM package for Python, implemented in Cython for speed.

dependent_to.name: py-faststructure
dependent_to.description:
FastStructure is a fast algorithm for inferring population structure
from large SNP genotype data.

dependent_to.name: py-gluoncv
dependent_to.description:
GluonCV provides implementations of state-of-the-art (SOTA) deep
learning algorithms in computer vision. It aims to help engineers,
researchers, and students quickly prototype products, validate new ideas
and learn computer vision.

dependent_to.name: py-line-profiler
dependent_to.description: Line-by-line profiler.

dependent_to.name: parsec
dependent_to.description:
PaRSEC: the Parallel Runtime Scheduler and Execution Controller PaRSEC
is a runtime and a programming toolbox that support the design and
parallel execution of micro-tasks on distributed, heterogeneous systems.

dependent_to.name: cantera
dependent_to.description:
Cantera is a suite of object-oriented software tools for problems
involving chemical kinetics, thermodynamics, and/or transport processes.

dependent_to.name: timemory
dependent_to.description:
Modular profiling toolkit and suite of libraries and tools for
C/C++/Fortran/CUDA/Python

dependent_to.name: py-pybedtools
dependent_to.description: Python wrapper -- and more -- for Aaron Quinlan's BEDTools

dependent_to.name: py-pyyaml
dependent_to.description: PyYAML is a YAML parser and emitter for Python.

dependent_to.name: py-spacy
dependent_to.description:
spaCy is a library for advanced Natural Language Processing in Python
and Cython.

dependent_to.name: bohrium
dependent_to.description: Library for automatic acceleration of array operations

dependent_to.name: py-mdanalysis
dependent_to.description:
MDAnalysis is a Python toolkit to analyze molecular dynamics
trajectories generated by a wide range of popular simulation packages
including DL_Poly, CHARMM, Amber, NAMD, LAMMPS, and Gromacs. (See the
lists of supported trajectory formats and topology formats.)
